definition: see 古爾邦節|古尔邦节[Gu3 er3 bang1 jie2]
to slaughter livestock/to govern or rule/to cheat customers/imperial official in dynastic China
domestic animal/sacrificial animal
see 節骨眼|节骨眼[jie1 gu5 yan3]
festival/holiday/node/joint/section/segment/part/to economize/to save/to abridge/moral integrity/classifier for segments, e.g. lessons, train wagons, biblical verses/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: Muslims around the world celebrate Eid al-Adha, marking the end of the Hajj. (Reuters/Denis Sinyakov)
sentences.chinese: 全世界的穆斯林庆祝宰牲节，标志着朝圣的结束。

sentences.english: Muslims around the world are preparing to celebrate Eid al-Adha, or the feast of sacrifice.
sentences.chinese: 世界各地的穆斯林正准备庆祝宰牲节或祭祀盛宴。

sentences.english: Muslims here and around the world began celebrating Eid al-Adha, or the Feast of the Sacrifice.
sentences.chinese: 本地和全世界的穆斯林欢度古尔邦节，即宰牲节。

definition: Eid al-Adha or Festival of the Sacrifice (Qurban), celebrated on the 10th day of the 12th month of the Islamic calendar
Eid al-Fitr or Feast of Breaking the Fast, celebrated on the last day of Ramadan
Ramadan (Islam)
Assumption of the Virgin Mary (Christian festival on 15th August)
see 開齋節|开斋节[Kai1 zhai1 jie2]
Deepavali (Hindu festival)
Medina, Saudi Arabia
Muslim
Islam
Hindu/adherent of Hinduism
Hanukkah (Chanukah), 8 day Jewish holiday starting on the 25th day of Kislev (can occur from late Nov up to late Dec on Gregorian calendar)/also called 哈努卡節|哈努卡节 and simply 哈努卡
imam (Islam) (loanword)
All Saints' Day (Christian festival on 2nd November)
Yom Kippur or Day of Atonement (Jewish holiday)
Diwali (Hindu festival)
jummah or Friday, when Muslims gather to attend prayers (loanword from Arabic)
